revised_title: Investigating the Time Delay Between Geomagnetic Storms and Atmospheric Density Variations
tldr: The authors analyzed drag data from the Explorer 9 satellite to study the time delay between geomagnetic storms and atmospheric density variations. They found that the mean delay time was approximately 1 day, and the atmospheric response following a geomagnetic disturbance occurred at the same time for all longitudes in the equatorial region. This study provides insights into the heating mechanism during geomagnetic disturbances and the relationship between geomagnetic activity and atmospheric density variations.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
